title: 3 Key Takeaways From the Bondi Hearing
summary: The session before a Senate panel featured more fireworks than facts as Democrats and the attorney general repeatedly clashed.

title: Health Care Politics Bolster Democrats in Shutdown Fight
summary: Even President Trump has conceded that he and his party could face political pain from rising premiums, stiffening Democrats’ spines as they demand a subsidy extension.

title: Mass Layoffs Trump Is Threatening in Shutdown Fight May Be Illegal
summary: Unions have sued to block any firings, which budget experts believe are not even needed to protect essential federal services.

title: Trump Suggests Furloughed Federal Workers May Not Receive Back Pay After Shutdown
summary: Union leaders and Democratic lawmakers say the move would run afoul of a law adopted under President Trump’s first term.

title: What Does the National Guard Do? Why Are Its Troops in U.S. Cities?
summary: The Guard has been federally mobilized around the country at least 10 times since World War II, with presidents using it to respond to civil unrest.

title: New Race-Day Worry for the Chicago Marathon: Immigration Enforcement
summary: Tensions over the federal intervention in the city have many runners worried about what to expect during the race, which passes through immigrant neighborhoods and draws many participants from abroad.

title: Klarna, Affirm, Afterpay: How ‘Buy Now Pay Later’ Built a New Culture of Consumption
summary: ‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ has built a delirious new culture of consumption — and trapped users in a vortex of debt.

title: Israel Marks Two-Year Anniversary of Oct. 7 in Subdued Fashion
summary: The somber milestone comes with peace talks underway, hostages from the Hamas-led attack still in Gaza, more than 67,000 Palestinians dead and Israel more isolated than ever.

title: Witkoff and Kushner Expected to Join Israel-Hamas Talks
summary: Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, both architects of President Trump’s plan to end the war, are expected to join mediation efforts between Israel and Hamas.

title: In a Private Park in North Carolina, Confederate Statues Are Rising Again
summary: A state law limits what can happen to a Confederate statue after it is removed. Valor Memorial, a private park, has become a destination for some.

title: Saul Zabar, Smoked Fish Czar of Upper West Side, Dies at 97
summary: He led his parents’ appetizing store, Zabar’s, for more than 70 years, turning it into an institution synonymous with New York.

title: Hunter Biden Pursued a Deal to Sell Land Around the U.S. Embassy in Romania
summary: The proposed transaction, stemming from relationships that started while his father was vice president and involving a Chinese partner, underscores the extent of Mr. Biden’s questionable business dealings abroad.

title: Oct. 7 Anniversary Arrives During Heated Final Stretch of Mayor’s Race
summary: Both Zohran Mamdani and Andrew Cuomo planned to attend events marking the anniversary of the Hamas attacks and honoring the victims.

title: The Next Leader of a Key N.Y.C. Business Group? He’s From New Jersey.
summary: Steven Fulop, the mayor of Jersey City, will take over as the head of the Partnership for New York City. Kathryn Wylde, a city power broker, has held the position for decades.

title: As Blue Jays Advance, America’s Pastime Is in Canada’s Cross Hairs
summary: Political tensions remain high between the United States and Canada, making this a striking moment for the Toronto Blue Jays to be dominating the New York Yankees in October.

title: Carney and Trump: A Collision Avoided, Save for a Nasty Comment or Two
summary: The Canadian prime minister came to Washington determined to take the heat out of the relationship. He mostly succeeded, at least for now.

title: Emeril’s Restaurant Revived by His 22-Year-Old Son? Bam, 3 Stars!
summary: Three years ago, E.J. Lagasse took over his father’s New Orleans flagship restaurant and made it an enchanting tasting-menu experience.

title: 200 Animals and a 95-Year-Old Are Found Inside a Squalid Suburban Home
summary: The woman was confined to her room by clutter, and a Long Island wildlife rehabilitator faces charges. The authorities found everything from cats to voles, many of them in dire conditions.

title: Trump Is Not Afraid of Civil War. Neither Is Stephen Miller.
summary: After all, there is “an enemy within.”

title: An Ideological Revolution Needs 12 Years in Power
summary: The Trump administration has a long way to go.

title: In Israel, the Anniversary of Oct. 7 Was Quiet but Inescapable
summary: Also, the Supreme Court seemed skeptical of a ban on conversion therapy. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Ex-Husband Contradicts a Man Appealing Conviction in Pelicot Rape Case
summary: The man said he did not know Gisèle Pelicot had been drugged. Her ex-husband, who admitted drugging and raping her and inviting strangers to join him, testified that the man knew.

title: N.J. Attorney General Investigating Uber Over Handling of Sexual Assaults
summary: The investigation, according to people with knowledge of the inquiry, is focused on whether Uber committed consumer fraud in how it promoted consumer safeguards.

title: Mars Orbiter Captures Rare Images of Interstellar Comet 3I/ATLAS
summary: 3I/ATLAS, only the third object from beyond our solar system ever spotted from Earth, was viewed from Mars by an orbiting European spacecraft.

title: John B. Gurdon, 92, Dies; Nobelist Paved Way for Cloning of Animals
summary: His work in the manipulation of cells laid the foundation for stem cell biology and regenerative medicine and led to the first cloned large mammal, a sheep named Dolly.
